suspect.translation[0].definitions[0].de: to think that something is probably true, especially something bad
suspect.translation[0].definitions[0].ex: She’s not going to be very happy about this, I suspect.
I suspected that there was something wrong with the engine.
She strongly suspected he was lying to her.
suspect.translation[0].definitions[1].de: to think that something bad has happened or is happening
suspect.translation[0].definitions[1].ex: The position of the body led the police to suspect murder.
suspect.translation[0].definitions[2].de: to think that someone is probably guilty of a crime
suspect.translation[0].definitions[2].ex: Pilcher was suspected of giving away government secrets to the enemy.
suspect.translation[0].definitions[3].de: to think that something is not honest or true
suspect.translation[0].definitions[3].ex: I began to suspect his motives in inviting me.
suspect.translation[0].note_box[0].items: You suspect that someone does, did, or has done something
I suspect he took the money
I suspect they have met before
You suspect that something may or might be true
We suspect that he may know something about the robbery
The police suspect that he might be a terrorist
You suspect that someone may or might have  done something
Police suspect Foster may have been involved in a fraud
I suspect he might have exaggerated a lot of the things in the book
You suspected that something would happen
He suspected that the problem would only get worse
I suspected that I would not enjoy the meeting
In all the above patterns, ‘that’ is optional  I suspect that or just I suspect
Suspect is not used in the progressive You say
suspect.translation[1].definitions[0].de: someone who is thought to be guilty of a crime
suspect.translation[1].definitions[0].ex: Two suspects were arrested today in connection with the robbery.
Police have issued a description of the murder suspect.
Davies is still the chief suspect.
the two suspects for the robbery
a suspect in a burglary case
suspect.translation[1].note_box[0].secti: She didn’t realise he was the prime suspect in a murder case.
I was the one who found her. And that makes me the number one suspect for her murder.
The murder suspect is described as in his early 20s, wearing a baseball type cap and a dark jacket.
The police drew up a list of possible suspects.
Detectives arrested the suspect after a five-day undercover operation.
Police confirmed that six suspects are being questioned.
suspect.translation[2].definitions[0].de: not likely to be completely honest
suspect.translation[2].definitions[0].ex: I’ve always thought he was a bit of a suspect character.
The company was involved in some highly suspect business dealings.
suspect.translation[2].definitions[1].de: not likely to be completely true
suspect.translation[2].definitions[1].ex: The two men were convicted on the basis of some highly suspect evidence.
suspect.translation[2].definitions[2].de: likely to have problems and not work well
suspect.translation[2].definitions[2].ex: The engine sounded a bit suspect.
suspect.translation[2].definitions[3].de: likely to contain a bomb or something illegal or dangerous
suspect.translation[2].definitions[3].ex: Police were called in to check out a suspect van.
